e4: The recommendation to switch to the new policy is based on the principle of transparency and ethical financial reporting. By reporting true earnings, the company minimizes the risk of legal repercussions and aligns its practices with investor expectations. While some investors may initially misunderstand the changes, fostering a culture of honesty will ultimately strengthen investor confidence and support long-term growth.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and consistency in presenting financial information. It should avoid any intentional bias or misrepresentation of earnings, ensuring that all stakeholders can make informed decisions based on reliable data. Additionally, ethical practices would include clear communication about accounting policies and changes, fostering trust and accountability amongst investors and regulatory bodies.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to communicate the change in reporting policy to investors to ensure they understand the shift to unbiased earnings. Additionally, I would inquire about potential strategies to mitigate any short-term negative market reactions and how they intend to support retail investors during this transition.
